comments.commentBody: He sounds like he's turning into Lady Macbeth.  "Out damned spot, out I say"
God I pray Alan is right.

As far as I can tell, there is some irony here, or perhaps downright mockery of the people and our system. This is through the Roy Cohn connection.

That is,

from Wikipedia on Cohn: ( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roy_Cohn )

"during the Second Red Scare, Cohn served as [Jospeh] McCarthy's chief counsel and gained special prominence during the Army–McCarthy hearings".

and "[Roy Cohn was] Donald Trump's attorney (1973–1978)".

Further, I recall on a Frontline before the election, which explored the personalities and histories of both Hillary Clinton and Donald Trump, Roy Cohn was said to be influential in forming Donald Trump's personality and tactics, particularly about the need to be very agressive to avoid you becoming a loser, etc.

(I leave it to readers with more knowledge, or the Times staff, to confirm details, as the Wikipedia article, and my recollection of a Frontline, aren't really airtight sources.)

Do the words "temperamentally unfit" ring a bell?

Preibus did not head with Drumpf to his fourth vacation this weekend; Bannon did. The source for the story was possibly Breitbart. Perhaps Bannon is feeding this stuff to POTUS, as a way of pushing him over the edge--who knows? The avowed Leninist Bannon wants everything to "come crashing down" in his words. What will it take for congressional GOP to wake up? They are all complicit in this disaster.
Desperate times call for desperate tweets.....unfit 2 B Presidit

I wish I had your self-discipline.  I sit at the computer all day, going from one news site to the next.  I think I'm wearing out my fingertips because I have so much to say against the Trumpet and his staff.  I will not let up until he's gone...and I don't care how he goes........

I completely disagree.  Obama has a platform like few others in this country... he should speak up and call it like it is.  Millions respect Obama and would be listening.  It's sort of like... if the only sensible person in the room is now saying Trump is crazy, then maybe Trump is really crazy.

This is just a simple misdirection play. Although I'm not sure it's a conscious one.

Again, right out of the GRU playbook.

When your opponents sniffs the trail, try to throw them off.

Say anything.

Do anything.

Then pray some of it sticks.

Is trump using his Chief Strategist, Steve Bannon's connection to Brietbart news to concoct a cover story?

It's pretty convenient that Brietbart published a story which implies the previous administration wire tapped Trump illegally.

This accusation gives an opening for Trump to make an accusation, based on an unsubstantiated so called news article, of illegal wire tapping which ultimately questions the veracity of any intelligence the intelligence community uncovers in its investigation.

Even though, according to a Reuters article published May 31, 2016, the 4th district US court of appeals ruled that the government can obtain and use data collected by a third party.

"The full 4th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals in Richmond, Virginia, voted 12-3 that the government can get the information under a decades-old legal theory that it had already been disclosed to a third party, in this case a telephone company".

Ultimately though, because of Brietbart's article and Trump's accusation, any evidence uncovered will automatically be in doubt.

At this point any evidence implicating Trump or his campaign of obstructing justice will now be disbelieved by many Brietbart followers.

Yes, it seems pretty convenient now to have the head of a news organization, lacking morals or ethics, at your disposal.

It is quite devastating to believe this is America's reality.

A LARGE number of Apartments in Trump Tower are OWNED by, guess who-oo?
Russian Oligarchs, Putin's pals...
of course Trump Tower is "wire tapped"!

With credit to Prof. Jennifer Freyd at the University of Oregon, like most narcissists, Trump is engage in classic "DARVO" behaviour:
- Deny
- Attack
- Reverse
- Victim and
- Offender

http://dynamic.uoregon.edu/jjf/defineDARVO.html

Phil, the difference is that Obama actually did inherit a mess. Trump, not so much.

Of course Obama didn't tap his phones. The FBI did. And Trump knows it. That's why he panicking.

Donald Trump appears truly unstable. Which by now is an understatement.
Time and time again he handles matters poorly. Far too much impulsive behavior has marked this short presidency.
To tweet such inflammatory information without evidence mirrors when he saw a program on Fox then insisted Sweden had a major terror attack.
He was made to look a fool, after being met with dripping global sarcasm.
Now he's called Obama a bad or a sick guy.
I suspect this will not bode well for the celebrity apprentice president.
Trump more likely is opening up a can of worms for himself and his own ties to Russia, and those of his staff.
This is really a mistake on Trump's part that could well have far-reaching consequences. Of all things to invent for false news. US officials are completely puzzled by Trump's behavior.
He looks fully unhinged, and it makes you wonder if Bannon is purposely trying to make Trump look this crazy.

$10,000? They paid three times that and more for a slave, in current dollars. That is peanuts, insulting.

$10,000 would not buy one year of college, less than a semester at a state school.

That is supposed to be a final remedy for generational disadvantage left over from slave culture and Jim Crow and endemic racism?

Take this and go back to your ghetto, bother us no more?

"Take this and go back to your ghetto, bother us no more?"

I lived in a modest lower middle class neighborhood on the near-eastside of Detroit (Chene Street). My family and I always considered it just that a modest neighborhood, nothing fancy and certainly not suburban.
Some time in the early 1970's we had many new residents who would curiously refer to the neighborhood as "the ghetto". My parents still saw our neighborhood as a livable modest one. More and more the newly arriving residents insisted it was "the ghetto" or "the hood". We thought why call it a ghetto? Well I guess eventually the new residents got their wish. I guess they did live in a ghetto - transformed totally from within...

Agreed.  I was thinking as I was reading Ross' article, maybe $100,000.  And maybe that wouldn't work.  If we limit to the descendants of slaves--not an indefensible idea--we have to pay something like what the real amount is.  And, honestly, I wondered if the real number might be more like $500,000 to a million. Remember, the years have been stacking up.

What a pathetic joke this column is. The reason we still need affirmative action is because racism still exists in this country. And the ghettos that create the disparity in outcome among races remain well entrenched in parts of America. And no more proof of racism thriving is needed than the election of Donald Trump. So white people are going to give every black $10,000 to even things up? That thought is intensely disrespectful even if this column was intended as satire. The scary thought is that you are being serious.

Every Planned Parenthood clinic erects this wall between abortion finances and financing for other services. I suspect the Maine clinic does too. Unfortunately, they will continue to fight this battle because several states have passed laws attempting to deny Medicaid funding to any clinic that provides abortion services, regardless of whether they separate the finances.

As a middle-aged white guy, why aren't we surprised Douthat would come up with the idea that writing a one-time check to each household proving African-American slave heritage would resolve racial inequity, past and present ?

A deeply unserious and disrespectful use of prime real estate.
'A deeply unserious and disrespectful use of prime real estate'. Totally agree.
Not that they're comparable, but it reminds of trying to give everyone tax credits so we can all (somehow, though this isn't explained) purchase unaffordable health insurance.

Either the bursal liberation of the Russian cat is imminent or Mr Trump is decompensating with respect to his suspected psychopathology as a result of the enormous stressors generated by his new job.
Surely, his tweets comprise sufficient evidence to formally assess him for the latter. If it turns out to be the former, then the psychiatrists can rest and the appropriate lawyers will be appointed.

I'm getting whiplash from all this Drump stories - this is absurd. Taking from an article in the Times. I would like to be informed but I also want to keep my sanity.

Four years of this stuff and his supporters are just blind to all his failings! Who are these people?

As I previously commented,  we have clearly reached the point where ( putting Constitutional niceties aside) the country needs to find this year's Van Johnson to tell this year's  Humphrey Bogart ( President Trump )in the Caine Mutiny that "Captain, you are a very sick man and  I am relieving you of command" The president is, by any metric,  a very sick man!

Of course, he was wiretapped. Given the allegations and credibility of the Russian Dossier, it would have been a dereliction of duty if he hadn't been. But as Obama's carefully worded statement makes clear, the order for the wiretap didn't come from the White House, it came from the FBI. Now that Trump has lost the protection of Sessions in the DoJ he's moved to plan B which is to try to discredit the information collected in the wiretap by casting it as nefarious political espionage, not credible legal evidence. Watch for a big shoe to drop soon.
There is absolutely NO evidence that Trump Towers was tapped. Do you think Trump had no Security? EE Gods!
Packman, where is your proof besides the words of Trump, a chronic liar. You don't want to be like him.
Just one simple question: Is this this man, is REALLY this man, RUNNING YOUR COUNTRY/ THE WORLD????   Shocking...
No Steve Bannon is.
I'm with you. Every day I hope for his impeachment. I'm ashamed to be an American these days.
Don't blame me Charles from Spain . I voted for Hillary . Don't rub it in , please . We feel awful enough !
I feel so sorry for America. The office of the President has been turned into a joke. A nation's moral standing is under question in the wider world.
The US hasn't had any real moral authority for.... God who knows...decdes and decades.

Well, gotta hand it to Donald Trump. According to NBC News' Brad Jaffy this morning Donald had the following major accomplishments:
At 6:35 AM he tweeted about the "wire tap"
At 8:19 AM he tweeted about reality tv
At 9:26 AM he played golf.

Yessiree. The White House is in shambles, and Donnie got in some golf. First things first, right?
It's ok – Trump is white. It's only Black Presidents who shouldn't golf (lest people accuse them of being "lazy").
It was a wire "tapp"  Too bad he wasted one of his 140 characters.  He might have said something profound
Glad I don't watch NBC News. They aren't doing their job probably because Comcast needs something from Trump.

We already know Obama used the FISA courts to spy on American citizens (ask James Rosen, the Fox reporter). Additionally we know he spied on Angela Merkel. These are the ones we know about.

If he instructed his minions (Holder, etc) to use a secret court to spy on a political opponent that is A crime pure and simple. This is the United States, not East Germany.
Dr M . Check your facts and watch a different Tv station for a change. You make assertions that have no bearing in hard facts. Be careful not to sound like Trump. He does that all the time
That would be profound if you had even a spec of evidence.

Given your concerns I need to ask if you contacted your Senators and Congressional Representative to investigate President Obama. Let's get down to to the truth. With a Republican President, House and Senate what are they waiting for! At the same time they are investigating this matter they can also investigate the 3-5 million fraudulent voters President Trump spoke about in January. Let's not forget Banghazi, and further investigations of Secretary Clinton and the filing of criminal charges that Attorney General Sessions could put forth. What are they waiting for??? I'm certain President Trump has other matters that I have overlooked. Feel free to add to the list, call your representatives and get the ball rolling!
The unraveling continues. Of his mind.
